attributes.action: Prime Ministers must serve a full term to receive the PDCA of £115K
attributes.additional_details: It is an abuse of taxpayer's money and does not incentivise politicians to conduct themselves in the manner to which the public expect.
attributes.background: Prime Ministers must serve a full term in office to receive the automatic PDCA of £115,000.

rejection.details:
We're not exactly sure what you'd like to happen.

The Public Duty Costs Allowance is not an automatic payment. It is claimable for reimbursement of incurred expenses for necessary office costs and secretarial costs arising from former Prime Minister's special position in public life. You can find out more about this allowance here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/public-duty-cost-allowance/public-duty-costs-allowance-guidance

You may wish to sign one of these petitions which we've published: 

Restrict Public Duties Cost allowance to Prime Ministers who won an election: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625646

Introduce a three month "qualifying period" for Prime Minister PDCA eligibility: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625990

Abolish the Public Duties Cost Allowance (PDCA) for former Prime Ministers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625940
